section.name: ODML-Amplifier
section.definition: The amplifier section defines elements that can be used to describe amplifier properties and settings.

property.name: SerialNo
property.definition: The device's serial number.

property.name: InventoryNo
property.definition: The inventory number of the device.

property.name: Owner
property.definition: Who's the owner of the device.

property.name: Model
property.definition: The model name of this hardware item.

property.name: Manufacturer
property.definition: The Manufacturer of this hardware item.

property.name: HighpassCutoff
property.definition: The cutoff frequency of the amplifier's highpass filter.

property.name: LowpassCutoff
property.definition: The cutoff frequency of the amplifier's lowpass filter.

property.name: Description
property.definition: A description of this hardware item.
property.value: digital DC amplifier, input 5V DC, 450 mA

section.name: ODML-Analysis
section.definition: Sections of the Analysis type can be used to describe analyses.

property.name: Author
property.definition: The name of the person who did the analysis, e.g. 'John Doe' or 'Doe, John'

property.name: Date
property.definition: The date of analysis.

property.name: Description
property.definition: A general description of the analysis.

property.name: Method
property.definition: The name of a method used in this analysis. E.g. "power spectrum".

property.name: CommandlineCall
property.definition: The command used to execute the analysis including the command line parameter.

property.name: Comment
property.definition: Specific comments on this analysis.

property.name: ResultFigure
property.definition: A figure showing the results. This property is meant to strore the real figure content. This will blow up the the size of the metadatafile and we recommend to rather define the URL of the figure.

section.name: ODML-Experiment
section.definition: Specification of an experiment. The Experiment is part of a Project and the recorded data for a specific Experiment are found in Datasets. Possible subsections are, for example, Dataset and Stimulus.

property.name: Description
property.definition: A description of the experiment.
property.value: Each patient or their legal representatives are acquainted with the course of the experiment and answered questions concerning his/her health. Each patient is given the standard EEG cap made by Electro-Cap International. The international 10-20 system of electrode placement was used. In fact, 7 electrodes from 19 were used as depicted in Figure. The reference electrode was placed at the root of his/her nose and the ground electrode was placed on the ear. The patient with EEG cap is sitting 1 m from the monitor and is told to watch the stimulation protocols which contain figures, sounds or matrix with activities, and to follow the rules for selecting thoughtful activity. EEG signal from all channels are amplified and together with markers of the events from parallel port interface from stimulation computer are delivered to recording PC. After the experiment is finished, the recorded data and collected metadata are uploaded to the EEG/ERP storage.

property.name: Type
property.definition: The type of experiment.

property.name: ProjectName
property.definition: The name of the project this experiment belongs to.
property.value: Brain-driven Computer Assistance System for People with Limited Mobility

property.name: ProjectID
property.definition: The ID of the project this experiment belongs to.

property.name: Software name
property.definition: The software's name.

property.name: Owner
property.definition: The owner of the software.

property.name: Developer
property.definition: The developer or the developers firm.

property.name: Version
property.definition: Version of the software.

property.name: Decsription
property.definition: The descrisption of the software.
property.value: "Presentation is a stimulus delivery and experiment control program for neuroscience. It runs on any Windows PC, and delivers auditory, visual and multimodal stimuli with sub-millisecond temporal precision. Presentation is powerful enough to handle almost any behavioral, psychological or physiological experiment using fMRI, ERP, MEG, psychophysics, eye movements, single neuron recording, reaction time measures, other performance measures, and more." [https://www.neurobs.com/]

section.name: ODML-Subject
section.definition: The investigated experimental subject (animal or person). May contain the Cell and Preparation sections as subsections.

property.name: Species
property.definition: The scientific name of the species e.g. Apis mellifera, Homo sapiens.

property.name: TrivialName
property.definition: The trivial name of the species like Honeybee, Human.

property.name: Gender
property.definition: Male or female?

property.name: Birthday
property.definition: The birthday. Age can be inferred from the date of recording.

property.name: Age
property.definition: The age of the subject since birth. E.g. P19, or 5 days.

property.name: HealthStatus
property.definition: Information about the health status of this subject.
